p: Although serology, in practice, refers to the antibodies in the blood, in the context of CNS viral infections the CSF antibodies are also measured and interlinked with the serological diagnosis of viral infections. Serology in general is of limited value unless serial samples are analyzed and serum and CSF results are compared. Antibody production is a dynamic process. It takes 10â€“14 days for antibodies to become positive initially, and then antibodies steadily rise to peak production and remain positive for years in latent infections [ 10, 20].
